basics.name: Devin Khun
basics.label: Developer & Cybersecurity Enthusiast
basics.summary: I am a software developer with a passion for computer science and cybersecurity. I have a strong background in applied mathematics and computer science, and I am always looking to learn more about the latest advancements in these fields.

work.name: Cal Poly Pomona, College of Business Administration CIS
highlights: Tutored 10+ students in Java programming, covering core concepts such as variables, loops, arrays, and object-oriented principles (inheritance, encapsulation, polymorphism).
Led one-on-one and small group sessions focused on debugging, problem-solving strategies, and best coding practices.
Guided students through practical coding exercises, emphasizing clean code, logic tracing, and test-driven development.

work.name: Alteryx Southern California Datathon
highlights: Leveraged Alteryx Designer to enhance and cleanse real-world data sets to achieve 85% improved data processing performance for practical use cases, outperforming in the top 50 participants.
Delivered practical implications and actionable recommendations to panel of 5 judges, effectively communicating client-focused analytical insights to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Collaborated with cross-functional team of data enthusiasts, utilizing Tableau and PowerBI for visually compelling dashboards to maintain efficient workflows.

work.name: First Robotics Team 867
highlights: Led monthly mentoring workshops in team building and problem-solving to 20+ student engineers, offering valuable insights into best practices and technical expertise in robotics.
Assisted 20+ students in addressing technical engineering challenges, fostering problem-solving skills, and encouraging innovative approaches to overcome obstacles.

projects.name: Students With an Interest in the Future of Technology
highlights: Executed system hardening techniques and defensive strategies in Red vs. Blue (RvB) competitions, responding to business injects on inventory management, incident reports, and firewall solutions.
Engaged in workshops covering topics of AWS pentesting, Windows Active Directory, and network security.
Completed a 10-week bootcamp to prepare for CCDC and CPTC competitions, honing cybersecurity and incident response skills.

projects.name: Codepath
projects.summary: Web Development | Technical Interview Prep | Cybersecurity
highlights: Enhanced full-stack web development with React and Supabase, collaborated in a 10-week fellowship, and expanded professional network through career fairs and summits.

Practiced technical interview strategies using the UMPIRE problem-solving framework in a collaborative setting, working through data structures and algorithms with peers to improve clarity, speed, and confidence in whiteboarding sessions.

Built foundational skills in cybersecurity through hands-on labs covering web vulnerabilities, network security, and exploit analysis, including participation in CTF-style challenges and secure code reviews.

projects.name: BroncoDirectMe, Cal Poly Pomona Student Registration Chrome Extension
highlights: Developed customer-focused features from Agile stories in ensuring continuous delivery through sprint cycles andoptimizing the enrollment process of the registration portal, gaining 245+ active users.
Utilized Typescript and React framework to implement responsive user interface, enhancing the functionality of theextension and enabling easy access to RateMyProfessor data.
Conducted market research in Agile methodology to drive customer-centric quality through conducting daily teamstand-up meetings, demonstrations, and code reviews with the team.
